artist: Artist: Frederick Landseer Maur Griggs; Printer: Frederick Landseer Maur Griggs
catalogue_raissonne: Alexander 34 i/vi; Wright & Dodgson 34; Comstock 34 i/vii
description: View of an imaginary medieval Gothic citadel in snow, with several musicians playing instruments and singing.
inscription: Inscribed in pencil, LL, recto: The Almonry. F.L. GRIGGS, A.R.A. / Earliest Working Proof. - Before figures were shaded. before initials were added. (illegible) / Touched. / R245W
markings: Artist\'s stamp in olive ink, verso: D+P (D reversed) (Lugt  760a). Previous owner\'s initials in pencil, verso: A.J.F. (Alexander Joseph Finberg, 1866-1939, British art historian and critic)
medium: Etching with additions in black ink on cream laid paper; trial proof
provenance: The artist, London. (L.760a); Alexander J. Finberg, London. Herschel V. Jones, Minneapolis until d.1928; inherited by Tessie Wilcox Jones (daughter), 1928-d.1967; bequethed by Tessie Jones to MIA as "Bequest of Herschel V. Jones," 1968.
signed: Signed in pencil, LR margin: F. L. Griggs
title: The Almonry
